Uses of Class
com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers.StealingCallbackExecutor

    • Uses of StealingCallbackExecutor in com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers

      Methods in com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers that return StealingCallbackExecutor 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static StealingCallbackExecutor StealingCallbackExecutors.newCachedThreadPool()
      Creates a StealingCallbackExecutor that expands the amount of threads it has dynamically so that each new task gets its own thread if none is available.
      static StealingCallbackExecutor StealingCallbackExecutors.newCachedThreadPool​(RejectedExecutionHandler rejectedHandler)
      Creates a StealingCallbackExecutor that expands the amount of threads it has dynamically so that each new task gets its own thread if none is available.
      static StealingCallbackExecutor StealingCallbackExecutors.newFixedThreadPool​(int threadCount)
      Creates a StealingCallbackExecutor with a fixed amount of threads in its pool and with work stealing enabled by default.
      static StealingCallbackExecutor StealingCallbackExecutors.newFixedThreadPool​(int threadCount, RejectedExecutionHandler rejectedHandler)
      Creates a StealingCallbackExecutor with a fixed amount of threads in its pool and with work stealing enabled by default.
      static StealingCallbackExecutor StealingCallbackExecutors.newSingleThreadExecutor()
      Creates a StealingCallbackExecutor that can only have 1 thread in it and with work stealing enabled.
      static StealingCallbackExecutor StealingCallbackExecutors.newSingleThreadExecutor​(RejectedExecutionHandler rejectedHandler)
      Creates a StealingCallbackExecutor pool that can only have 1 thread in it and with work stealing enabled.
      Method parameters in com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers with type arguments of type StealingCallbackExecutor 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void StealingCallbackFuture.addCancellationCallback​(Consumer<StealingCallbackExecutor> onCancellation)
      Adds a callback to run on cancellation from the thread that cancelled the computation.
      void StealingCallbackFutureTask.addCancellationCallback​(Consumer<StealingCallbackExecutor> onCancellation)  
      void StealingCallbackFuture.addFailureCallback​(BiConsumer<StealingCallbackExecutor,​? super Throwable> onFailure)
      Adds a callback to run on failure from the thread that executed the computation.
      void StealingCallbackFutureTask.addFailureCallback​(BiConsumer<StealingCallbackExecutor,​? super Throwable> onFailure)  
      void StealingCallbackFuture.addSuccessCallback​(BiConsumer<StealingCallbackExecutor,​? super V> onSuccess)
      Adds a callback to run on success from the thread that executed the computation.
      void StealingCallbackFutureTask.addSuccessCallback​(BiConsumer<StealingCallbackExecutor,​? super V> onSuccess)  
      Constructors in com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers with parameters of type StealingCallbackExecutor 
      Constructor Description
      StealingCallbackFutureTask​(Runnable runnable, V value, StealingCallbackExecutor executor)
      Creates a StealingCallbackFutureTask which will execute the provided runnable, giving the provided value to threads waiting after execution.
      StealingCallbackFutureTask​(Runnable runnable, V value, StealingCallbackExecutor executor, Consumer<? super Throwable> callbackFailureHandler)
      Creates a StealingCallbackFutureTask which will execute the provided runnable, giving the provided value to threads waiting after execution.
      StealingCallbackFutureTask​(Callable<V> callable, StealingCallbackExecutor executor)
      Creates a StealingCallbackFutureTask which will execute the provided callable when it's run, providing its returned value to threads waiting after execution.
      StealingCallbackFutureTask​(Callable<V> callable, StealingCallbackExecutor executor, Consumer<? super Throwable> callbackFailureHandler)
      Creates a StealingCallbackFutureTask which will execute the provided callable when it's run, providing its returned value to threads waiting after execution.
